intro: Beschorneria rigida, commonly known as the rigid beschorneria, is a species of flowering plant in the Asparagaceae family. It is native to Mexico and is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves that are thick, fleshy, and often covered in a waxy coating. The plant produces tall, spiky flower stalks that bear clusters of white or pale green flowers. It is well adapted to arid environments and requires minimal water once established. Its striking appearance makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
